column2: Conduct comprehensive patient evaluations, including medical history reviews, physical examinations, and neurological assessments, to diagnose and treat various neurological conditions     Collaborate with attending physicians, specialists, and interdisciplinary teams to develop individualized treatment plans and coordinate patient care across multiple healthcare settings     Order and interpret diagnostic tests and imaging studies, such as MRI, CT scans, and electroencephalograms (EEG), to assist in the diagnosis and management of neurological disorders     Provide expert consultation and guidance to healthcare providers, residents, and medical students on the evaluation and management of neurological conditions, including stroke, epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, and movement disorders     Participate in patient rounds, case conferences, and multidisciplinary meetings to review clinical cases, discuss treatment options, and optimize patient outcomes     Educate patients and their families about neurological disorders, treatment options, medication regimens, and lifestyle modifications to promote wellness and disease prevention     Document patient encounters, treatment plans, and clinical notes accurately and comprehensively in electronic health records (EHR) systems in compliance with regulatory requirements and professional standards     Stay abreast of current literature, research findings, and evidence-based practices in neurology through continuous learning, professional development activities, and participation in conferences and seminars

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Associate Consultant - Neurology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey   Clinical Evaluation: Neurologists perform thorough clinical evaluations of patients who present with neurological symptoms. They take detailed medical histories and conduct physical and neurological examinations to identify potential issues.      Diagnostic Testing: Neurologists may order and interpret various diagnostic tests, such as neuroimaging (like MRI and CT scans), electroencephalograms (EEGs), electromyography (EMG), and nerve conduction studies to aid in the diagnosis of neurological conditions.      Treatment: Once a diagnosis is made, neurologists develop and implement treatment plans. Treatment options may include medications, physical therapy, lifestyle changes, and, in some cases, surgical interventions.        Neurological Disorders: Neurologists address a wide range of neurological disorders, including but not limited to:          Headaches and migraines      Seizures and epilepsy      Stroke      Multiple sclerosis      Alzheimer's disease and other dementias      Parkinson's disease      Peripheral neuropathies      Neuromuscular disorders      Movement disorders      Brain and spinal cord injuries      Brain tumors        Research: Some neurologists are involved in clinical research to advance the understanding and treatment of neurological conditions. They may work on clinical trials and studies to explore new therapies and interventions.      Patient Education: Neurologists educate patients and their families about their condition, available treatment options, and lifestyle modifications that may be necessary for managing their condition.

column2: Position:  Consultant Department:  Rheumatology Experience:  8+ years Qualification:  DM (Clinical Immunology & Rheumatology ) Contact person:  Ms. Pooja Chauhan /Mr. Shikhar Maheshwari (9311328880) Interested Candidates please mail your resume to  pooja.chauhan@jalindia.co.in / shikhar.maheshwari@jalindia.co.in Immediate joiners prefered

Capital Hospitals is looking for Consultant - Neuro Surgeon to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Specializes in the surgical treatment of conditions affecting the brain, spinal cord, and nerves      Responsibilities include evaluating patients, ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests, developing treatment plans, and performing surgeries      Prescribing medication and performing follow-up evaluations      Must have strong surgical skills, as well as a thorough understanding of anatomy, physiology, and medical technologies

SRMC University is looking for Fellowship Program in Oral Oncology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Clinical Focus:Oral oncology fellowships emphasize the clinical evaluation, diagnosis, staging, treatment planning, and multidisciplinary management of oral cancer patients      Fellows work closely with experienced oncologists, head and neck surgeons, radiation oncologists, medical oncologists, oral and maxillofacial surgeons, pathologists, radiologists, and other healthcare professionals involved in the comprehensive care of patients with head and neck cancers      Clinical rotations may include participation in outpatient clinics, inpatient services, tumor boards, multidisciplinary conferences, and surgical procedures related to oral cancer treatment      Treatment Modalities:Fellows receive training in the full spectrum of treatment modalities for oral cancers, including surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy, and palliative care      They learn about surgical techniques for tumor resection, neck dissection, reconstruction, and rehabilitation following ablative procedures      Fellows gain insights into the principles of radiation therapy planning, delivery techniques, treatment protocols, and management of treatment-related side effects and complications      Patient Care and Support:Fellows develop expertise in providing compassionate, patient-centered care to individuals diagnosed with oral cancer and their families      They learn to address the physical, emotional, psychological, and social needs of patients throughout the cancer care continuum, from diagnosis and treatment decision-making to survivorship and end-of-life care      Fellows may engage in patient education, counseling, symptom management, supportive care interventions, and referrals to ancillary services such as speech therapy, nutrition counseling, pain management, and psychosocial support programs      Research and Scholarly Activities:Some fellowship programs include opportunities for fellows to engage in clinical research projects, translational studies, quality improvement initiatives, and scholarly activities related to oral oncology      Fellows may have access to research resources, databases, institutional review boards (IRBs), and collaborative research networks to conduct studies, analyze data, publish articles, and present findings at scientific meetings and conferences      Mentorship from experienced investigators and faculty members helps fellows develop research skills, critical thinking abilities, and academic productivity essential for a career in academic medicine or cancer research
